results.title: Belles of the south seas
results.brief_description: Documentary travelogue view of the south sea islands and their native peoples. Includes Tahiti, New Zealand (South Island), Fiji, Samoan Islands, Papua and Kalabahi.

results.title: Bellamy's Daintree: where reef meets rainforest
results.creator_credit: Wilderness Society and Australian Conservation Foundation
results.brief_description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.
results.description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.

results.title: Bell & Howell Model 601 16mm Film Projector with Speaker, Tripod and Accessories
results.last_on_display_place: Australian Centre for the Moving Image
results.material_description:
001: metal
002: metal and wood
003: cast iron mechanics with a vinyl case
004: speaker in wooden carry case with green vinyl finish and red material.
005: plastic
006: wooden base and metal top.  The metal has tarnished to a green colour and there is brown rust.
007: plastic
008: glass and metal bulbs wrapped in bubble-wrap and housed in original cardboard box.
009: plastic with a metal centre.
010: metal on wooden base.
011: metal case
012: metal (cast-iron?) case
013: metal, leather and plastic
014: plastic rubber
015: red vinyl, wood, rubber, leather and metal.
results.brief_description: Movie projector with accessories. Metal tripod and screw in projector base with a flat platform. Bell and Howell Model 601 projector in case which fits the projector stand. There is also a like projector which isn’t in a case, that was likely a backup or replacement projector for that housed in the canvas. There is the companion Bell and Howell speaker, and also a no brand red-coloured miscellaneous speaker. Housed in the Bell and Howell speaker are two empty reels (1 x 400ft and 1 x 1600ft 16mm), cords, 2x globes, a wooden based film reel winder, and a film splicer. A Bell & Howell Amp/Mixer, and a power box which plugs into speaker/projector as a source of power.

results.title: Belgium and the Netherlands
results.brief_description: A survey of Belgium and the Netherlands, their relationship to each other and to their neighbours. Explains how their culture and economy are affected by environmental factors such as easy access to the North Sea, their small size and dense population and their coal resources. No other credits available.

results.title: Belgium
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: A skipper of a barge who travels the canals and rivers of Belgium tells about Belgium, describing its role as a historic invasion route since the days of Caesar. Discusses the country’s bi-lingual system, contrasts the fertile Flanders with the industrial south, and shows the importance of Antwerp as a European harbour.

results.title: Being right: can you still lose?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Questions, Answers.”.
An excerpt from the feature ” Ride a wild pony”, which has an Australian setting. Conflict flares when two children claim ownership of a wild pony. A judge settles the dispute by allowing the pony to decide. The film centres on how the children cope with the decision. The aim of the film is to allow children to explore the concepts of winning and losing and how to deal with them. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Being real about relationships
results.creator_credit: Betti Wood, Pilgrim Films, Family Film Movement and Laurie Tesoriero
results.brief_description: In the second half of the Twentieth Century there have been developments in contraception. The film explains the rhythm, the calender, the temperature, the ovulation, the withdrawal, the barrier, the diaphragm, the condom, the IUD, the pill and the sterilisation methods.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Betti Wood, Pilgrim Films, Family Film Movement and Laurie Tesoriero

results.title: Being in: Life Be In It
results.brief_description: Examines the ‘Life Be In It’ campaign, its progress and the continued support it needs form members of the community, and advocates ways of becoming a part of the program. The ‘Life Be In It’ campaign was aimed at fostering community involvement in physical recreation, physical fitness and healthier lifestyles for all Australian.
